qas.question: What category do composite panels, strand board, and plywood all fit into?
What's another word for glued laminated timber?
If current building trends continue, what material will be replaced by particle and fiber board?
About how many cubic meters of wood was used in 1991 to make products like glulam, LVL, and structural composite lumber?

context: These products include glued laminated timber (<a1_0>glulam<a1_0/>), <a0_0>wood structural panels<a0_0/> (including plywood, oriented strand board and composite panels), <a2_0>laminated veneer lumber<a2_0/> (LVL) and other structural composite lumber (SCL) products, parallel strand lumber, and I-joists. Approximately <a4_0>100 million<a4_0/> cubic meters of wood was consumed for this purpose in 1991. The trends suggest that particle board and fiber board will overtake <a3_0>plywood<a3_0/>.
